page.title: 10 HOUSING IN THE LOCALITY
page.content: This area is dominated by Cotswold style houses with limestone walls and split grey stone tiles. Sapperton village was much beloved by the Sapperton School of Craftsmen in the early 1900s, who ardently supported this country style. Houses they designed blend perfectly with earlier ones. Hill View, north of the Rectory, one of the oldest houses, is a 17th Century building with central gable. Of 66 houses in Sapperton 60 are built of traditional limestone. 32 are detached. The Glebe Housing Estate, built in 1966, contains 8 OAP bungalows and 12 semi detached houses built in a style which harmonises well. Far Oakridge has quite a lot of modern buildings, while Frampton Mansell is similar to Sapperton.
